channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CycleBNN: Cyclic Precision Training in Binary Neural Networks
item.description: This paper works on Binary Neural Networks (BNNs), a promising avenue for efficient deep learning, offering significant reductions in computational overhead and memory footprint to full precision networks.

item.title: ManiSkill3: GPU Parallelized Robotics Simulation and Rendering for Generalizable Embodied AI
item.description: We introduce and open source ManiSkill3, the fastest state-visual GPU parallelized robotics simulator with contact-rich physics targeting generalizable manipulation.

item.title: Enabling Synergistic Full-Body Control in Prompt-Based Co-Speech Motion Generation
item.description: Current co-speech motion generation approaches usually focus on upper body gestures following speech contents only, while lacking supporting the elaborate control of synergistic full-body motion based on text prompts, such as talking while walking.

item.title: Make Privacy Renewable! Generating Privacy-Preserving Faces Supporting Cancelable Biometric Recognition
item.description: Specifically, we propose a cancelable face generator (CanFG), which removes the physical identity for privacy protection and embeds the virtual identity for face recognition.

item.title: Posterior-Mean Rectified Flow: Towards Minimum MSE Photo-Realistic Image Restoration
item.description: Photo-realistic image restoration algorithms are typically evaluated by distortion measures (e. g., PSNR, SSIM) and by perceptual quality measures (e. g., FID, NIQE), where the desire is to attain the lowest possible distortion without compromising on perceptual quality.

item.title: Trainable pruned ternary quantization for medical signal classification models
item.description: The field of deep learning is renowned for its resource-intensive nature, hence improving its environmental impact is crucial.

item.title: Volumetric Conditional Score-based Residual Diffusion Model for PET/MR Denoising
item.description: PET imaging is a powerful modality offering quantitative assessments of molecular and physiological processes.

item.title: DAOcc: 3D Object Detection Assisted Multi-Sensor Fusion for 3D Occupancy Prediction
item.description: To this end, we propose DAOcc, a novel multi-sensor fusion occupancy network that leverages 3D object detection supervision to assist in achieving superior performance, while using a deployment-friendly image feature extraction network and practical input image resolution.

item.title: ProFD: Prompt-Guided Feature Disentangling for Occluded Person Re-Identification
item.description: To address the occlusion issues in person Re-Identification (ReID) tasks, many methods have been proposed to extract part features by introducing external spatial information.

item.title: Assessing interaction recovery of predicted protein-ligand poses
item.description: The field of protein-ligand pose prediction has seen significant advances in recent years, with machine learning-based methods now being commonly used in lieu of classical docking methods or even to predict all-atom protein-ligand complex structures.

item.title: CycleCrash: A Dataset of Bicycle Collision Videos for Collision Prediction and Analysis
item.description: Next, we propose VidNeXt, a novel method that leverages a ConvNeXt spatial encoder and a non-stationary transformer to capture the temporal dynamics of videos for the tasks defined in our dataset.

item.title: RouterDC: Query-Based Router by Dual Contrastive Learning for Assembling Large Language Models
item.description: To achieve this, routing is a promising method, which learns a router to select the most suitable LLM for each query.

item.title: PerCo (SD): Open Perceptual Compression
item.description: We introduce PerCo (SD), a perceptual image compression method based on Stable Diffusion v2. 1, targeting the ultra-low bit range.

item.title: SWIM: Short-Window CNN Integrated with Mamba for EEG-Based Auditory Spatial Attention Decoding
item.description: By joint training SW$_\text{CNN}$ and Mamba, the proposed SWIM structure uses both short-term and long-term information and achieves an accuracy of 86. 2%, which reduces the classification errors by a relative 31. 0% compared to the previous state-of-the-art result.

item.title: MemSim: A Bayesian Simulator for Evaluating Memory of LLM-based Personal Assistants
item.description: LLM-based agents have been widely applied as personal assistants, capable of memorizing information from user messages and responding to personal queries.

item.title: PuzzleBoard: A New Camera Calibration Pattern with Position Encoding
item.description: Accurate camera calibration is a well-known and widely used task in computer vision that has been researched for decades.

item.title: Accelerating Non-Maximum Suppression: A Graph Theory Perspective
item.description: The optimal eQSI-NMS, with only a $0. 3\%$ mAP decrease, achieves $10. 7\times$ speed.

item.title: Law of the Weakest Link: Cross Capabilities of Large Language Models
item.description: The development and evaluation of Large Language Models (LLMs) have largely focused on individual capabilities.

item.title: TaskComplexity: A Dataset for Task Complexity Classification with In-Context Learning, FLAN-T5 and GPT-4o Benchmarks
item.description: To tackle this issue, a novel dataset containing a total of 4, 112 programming tasks was created by extracting tasks from various websites.

item.title: GrokLST: Towards High-Resolution Benchmark and Toolkit for Land Surface Temperature Downscaling
item.description: Land Surface Temperature (LST) is a critical parameter for environmental studies, but obtaining high-resolution LST data remains challenging due to the spatio-temporal trade-off in satellite remote sensing.

item.title: Probabilistic Classification of Near-Surface Shallow-Water Sediments using A Portable Free-Fall Penetrometer
item.description: The geotechnical evaluation of seabed sediments is important for engineering projects and naval applications, offering valuable insights into sediment properties, behavior, and strength.

item.title: Textual Training for the Hassle-Free Removal of Unwanted Visual Data
item.description: Based on the analysis, we propose Hassle-Free Textual Training (HFTT), a streamlined method capable of acquiring detectors for unwanted visual content, using only synthetic textual data in conjunction with pre-trained vision-language models.

item.title: LexEval: A Comprehensive Chinese Legal Benchmark for Evaluating Large Language Models
item.description: Applying existing LLMs to legal systems without careful evaluation of their potential and limitations could pose significant risks in legal practice.

item.title: Enhancing High-order Interaction Awareness in LLM-based Recommender Model
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated prominent reasoning capabilities in recommendation tasks by transforming them into text-generation tasks.

item.title: PsyGUARD: An Automated System for Suicide Detection and Risk Assessment in Psychological Counseling
item.description: Our study not only provides an insightful analysis of the effectiveness of automated risk assessment systems based on fine-grained suicide detection but also highlights their potential to improve mental health services on online counseling platforms.

item.title: Camera Calibration using a Collimator System
item.description: This paper introduces a novel camera calibration method using a collimator system, which can provide a reliable and controllable calibration environment for cameras with varying working distances.

item.title: Knowledge Graph Embedding by Normalizing Flows
item.description: To reflect uncertainty, we first embed entities/relations as permutations of a set of random variables.

item.title: HazyDet: Open-source Benchmark for Drone-view Object Detection with Depth-cues in Hazy Scenes
item.description: By observing the significant variations in object scale and clarity under different depth and haze conditions, we designed a Depth Conditioned Detector (DeCoDet) to incorporate this prior knowledge.

item.title: Melody Is All You Need For Music Generation
item.description: We present the Melody Guided Music Generation (MMGen) model, the first novel approach using melody to guide the music generation that, despite a pretty simple method and extremely limited resources, achieves excellent performance.

item.title: On The Planning Abilities of OpenAI's o1 Models: Feasibility, Optimality, and Generalizability
item.description: Recent advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have showcased their ability to perform complex reasoning tasks, but their effectiveness in planning remains underexplored.

item.title: UniSumEval: Towards Unified, Fine-Grained, Multi-Dimensional Summarization Evaluation for LLMs
item.description: Existing benchmarks for summarization quality evaluation often lack diverse input scenarios, focus on narrowly defined dimensions (e. g., faithfulness), and struggle with subjective and coarse-grained annotation schemes.

item.title: All-in-One Image Coding for Joint Human-Machine Vision with Multi-Path Aggregation
item.description: Experimental results show that MPA achieves performance comparable to state-of-the-art methods in both task-specific and multi-objective optimization across human viewing and machine analysis tasks.

item.title: OrientedFormer: An End-to-End Transformer-Based Oriented Object Detector in Remote Sensing Images
item.description: However, directly extending transformers to oriented object detection presents three main issues: 1) objects rotate arbitrarily, necessitating the encoding of angles along with position and size; 2) the geometric relations of oriented objects are lacking in self-attention, due to the absence of interaction between content and positional queries; and 3) oriented objects cause misalignment, mainly between values and positional queries in cross-attention, making accurate classification and localization difficult.

item.title: CoT-ST: Enhancing LLM-based Speech Translation with Multimodal Chain-of-Thought
item.description: We propose CoT-ST, a speech translation model that utilizes multimodal CoT to decompose speech translation into sequential steps of speech recognition and translation.

item.title: Revealing Personality Traits: A New Benchmark Dataset for Explainable Personality Recognition on Dialogues
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel task named Explainable Personality Recognition, aiming to reveal the reasoning process as supporting evidence of the personality trait.

item.title: Effective Diffusion Transformer Architecture for Image Super-Resolution
item.description: In this work, we design an effective diffusion transformer for image super-resolution (DiT-SR) that achieves the visual quality of prior-based methods, but through a training-from-scratch manner.

item.title: Crafting Distribution Shifts for Validation and Training in Single Source Domain Generalization
item.description: The method that achieves the best performance on the augmented validation is selected from the proposed family.

item.title: Automatic debiasing of neural networks via moment-constrained learning
item.description: Causal and nonparametric estimands in economics and biostatistics can often be viewed as the mean of a linear functional applied to an unknown outcome regression function.

item.title: Underwater Organism Color Enhancement via Color Code Decomposition, Adaptation and Interpolation
item.description: ColorCode offers three key features: 1) color enhancement, producing an enhanced image with a fixed color; 2) color adaptation, enabling controllable adjustments of long-wavelength color components using guidance images; and 3) color interpolation, allowing for the smooth generation of multiple colors through continuous sampling of the color code.

item.title: DuoGNN: Topology-aware Graph Neural Network with Homophily and Heterophily Interaction-Decoupling
item.description: However, due to the local neighborhood aggregation paradigm in message passing which characterizes these models, they inherently suffer from two fundamental limitations: first, indistinguishable node embeddings due to heterophilic node aggregation (known as over-smoothing), and second, impaired message passing due to aggregation through graph bottlenecks (known as over-squashing).

item.title: Evolving Multi-Scale Normalization for Time Series Forecasting under Distribution Shifts
item.description: Complex distribution shifts are the main obstacle to achieving accurate long-term time series forecasting.

item.title: Hybrid Mamba for Few-Shot Segmentation
item.description: Hence, we aim to devise a cross (attention-like) Mamba to capture inter-sequence dependencies for FSS.

item.title: The Crucial Role of Samplers in Online Direct Preference Optimization
item.description: Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) has emerged as a stable, scalable, and efficient solution for language model alignment.

item.title: Simple and Fast Distillation of Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion-based generative models have demonstrated their powerful performance across various tasks, but this comes at a cost of the slow sampling speed.

item.title: Mitigating the Negative Impact of Over-association for Conversational Query Production
item.description: We carefully analyze the negative effects of this phenomenon on pretrained Seq2seq query producers and then propose effective instance-level weighting strategies for training to mitigate these issues from multiple perspectives.

item.title: Gradient is All You Need: Gradient-Based Attention Fusion for Infrared Small Target Detection
item.description: Infrared small target detection (IRSTD) is widely used in civilian and military applications.

item.title: CLIP-based Camera-Agnostic Feature Learning for Intra-camera Person Re-Identification
item.description: To address this, we propose a novel framework called CLIP-based Camera-Agnostic Feature Learning (CCAFL) for ICS ReID.

item.title: Can Large Language Models Analyze Graphs like Professionals? A Benchmark, Datasets and Models
item.description: Our results underscore that the capabilities of LLMs in handling structured data are still under-explored, and show the effectiveness of LLM4Graph in enhancing LLMs' proficiency of graph analysis.

item.title: See Detail Say Clear: Towards Brain CT Report Generation via Pathological Clue-driven Representation Learning
item.description: 2) Shifted semantic representing: Limited medical corpus causes difficulties for models to transfer the learned textual representations to generative layers.

item.title: Identifying Knowledge Editing Types in Large Language Models
item.description: However, there is a lack of effective measures to prevent the malicious misuse of this technology, which could lead to harmful edits in LLMs.
